page.title: 18THE UNITED CHURCH,VENTNOR.
page.content: The present church was built by Henry Ingram in 1862. It was originally called the High Street Wesleyan Methodist Chapel. It can seat 120 people but 200 have been accommodated. About 90 people attend the two services during the winter but this rises to 120 during the summer. There is a morning communion service once a month and an evening communion service every 3 months. Thirteen years ago the Congregational Church joined the Methodist Church to become the United Church. The Minister is the Revd. Raymond Thompson and he has 15 officers.He is responsible for 7 other churches. There is a Junior Church of approx. 25 children. Mr. Burnett is the organist. The church supports many charities and raises money through collections,covenants and bazaars.
